titlepage.titleproper: Inventory of the Rosemary Sprague Collection, 1919-1991
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Mss. Acc. 1991.01

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: The collection consists of 59 boxes of materials related to the life and career of Dr. Rosemary Sprague. Among this collection are correspondence, writings, personal and biographical materials including a collection of photographs, and a collection of miscellaneous materials.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from Greenwood Library, Longwood University, or the holder of the copyright, if not Longwood University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Rosemary Sprague Collection, Special Collections, Greenwood Library, Longwood University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were acquired by Longwood University in 1991.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Rosemary Sprague was a graduate of Bryn Mawr College and received her master's degree and doctorate from Case Western Reserve University. She also studied at the Shakespeare Institute, Stratford-on-Avon, and at Oxford University and the University of London. She taught English at Longwood from 1962 until her retirement in 1990. She was promoted to full professorship in 1965, and two years after that she became Longwood's first Board of Visitors Distinguished Professor. She was the author of nine historical novels for young adults, biographies of Robert Browning and George Eliot, and a study of five American poets entitled Imaginary Gardens and the Sesquicentennial History of Longwood College. Dr. Sprague was an accomplished actress who loved the theatre her entire life. Prior to teaching at Longwood, she was Director of Dramatics at Notre Dame College. In 1971, Dr. Sprague established the Victorian Institute in collaboration with two colleagues from the University of North Carolina. The Institute has developed into an international literary society. During her lifetime, she was involved in teaching, writing, acting, professional organizations, and community-based groups; but today, her legacy lives on in her writings that are still held in libraries throughout the country.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 59 boxes of materials related to the life and career of Dr. Rosemary Sprague. Among this collection are correspondence, writings, personal and biographical materials including a collection of photographs, and a collection of miscellaneous materials.

The collection is divided into the following series: Series I: Correspondence, Series 2: Manuscripts (published and unpublished writings, transcripts of lectures, and research notes), Series 3: Personal & Biographical Materials (including a large collection of photographs) Series 4: Miscellaneous Materials (includes ephemera, memorabilia, and items of personal interest).

Correspondence: This series includes seven boxes that are subdivided into the following categories: Correspondence with illustrator J. B. Lankes (1986-1991), Correspondence with Western Case University professor and writer Horace Abram Rigg (1969-72), Business correspondence with publishers, Other business correspondence and Correspondence with family and friends.

Manuscript Collection: This series contains notes related to the research of her published writings as well as numerous drafts of these works including galley proofs and sample book jackets. The materials are arranged alphabetically by title of the work. Contained in this series are unpublished writings and transcripts of her lectures.

Personal and Biographical Materials: This collection includes a large number of photographs that span her lifetime providing glimpses into her family background and childhood years. There are also documents related to her academic career and personal involvements. In addition, there are newspaper articles that span Sprague's lifetime revealing much about her youth and her involvements. Included is a large box containing printed materials and three-dimensional personal items collected by Sprague.

Miscellaneous Materials: Contained in this collection are memorabilia such as post cards and playbills. The bulk of the collection consists of miscellaneous print materials that were of interest to Sprague.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
